website_summaries.verdict: A great price for multiple drain snakes of two different types.
pros: Includes five plastic drain snakes and two stainless steel snakes with grippers at the end
Steel snakes are great for grabbing solid blockages
cons: Some buyers wished these were a bit longer
Steel snakes don't work as well as the plastic ones

customer_reviews.title: Wish they could be a little longer but get the job done for shallow clogs like hair in the shower drain or bathroom sink which ...
customer_reviews.text: They do the trick. Wish they could be a little longer but get the job done for shallow clogs like hair in the shower drain or bathroom sink which is what I bought them for. Don't confuse these with a snake. That they are not. The plunger type with grabbers are very strong. In fact I locked my keys in my car and used them to grab the lock. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: D. L

customer_reviews.title: Not particularly useful for drain clog removal
customer_reviews.text: The plastic removal tool with the teeth while flexible and rigid enough to get into the drain, the teeth are prone to shearing off, and not actually capturing as much as it can (not to mention leaves bits of plastic in the drain potentially making the issue worse). The snake grippers are too large for my drain (which is probably regular sized), though it could probably work if you remove the plunger beforehand. I would prefer something that can work without needing to remove the plunger. The value is okay though, since snake grippers can be useful for grabbing other things (dropped screw under engine hood, things beneath the couch or behind a dresser, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Bian

customer_reviews.title: Great product, works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I had a sink and tub drain that kept causing problems shortly after being cleared using other methods. These ripped out the largest, nastiest mess of hair and crap I've ever seen come out of a drain. After that, we have seen zero issues with the drains and I love that it didn't require dumping more chemicals down the drain. We all do that enough already with typical cleaning products and whatnot. These work exactly as expected and they are plenty long enough to get down into hard to clear clogged spots in the pipes.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley T

customer_reviews.title: Only if there’s not other way.
customer_reviews.text: The easiest to use is the metallic one because it has a hook so you can grab and then let go. But it’s a bit bigger so sometimes it won’t fit through the sink holes. The others at better for hairs because It can go deeper but unless you are not completely gross out by what came out is better to just throw it away than clean it. Plus is made of plastic so it gets even more gross. I guess they do the job but you would have to keep buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Daniella mendieta plata

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I used the orange plastic tool for a bathroom sink drain that 2 treatments with drain cleaner did not clear. Took ten minutes, and the drain was clear. I didn't pull the stopper out, just worked around it. Get ready to pull disgusting stuff from the drain. Be cautious when you pull it out because the curved plastic is very springy, and could flick black goo everywhere. I used a paper towel to prevent that...the second time I pulled it out! I used a paper towel to clean the tool between uses. Then threw away the tool when I was done. It's just long enough to get the job done. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S. Baker

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: The orange thing removed a slimy hairball in under a minute. No need to spend money on a plumber when you have this! I’m super cheap so I rinsed it off and plan to reuse it until the little teeth things break off. Even if you are only using each one once, it’s still well worth the money. I haven’t used the metal thing yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Works!  Great for minor de-clogs, great for keeping your sink/tub flowing
customer_reviews.text: I've only used the super cheap orange plastic doo-hickey but it works very well to drag up clumps of long hair from my sink & tub. I push the orange plastic thing down the drain & plunge it carefully up & down with short movements. It isn't a smooth process and pulling it out takes patience as the little sticky-outy parts hang up on the way out. But it pulls out trapped hair and gunk pretty well. I haven't used the other piece yet since I haven't needed it. These simple tools give me great power over my money since I am not paying a plumber to fix a clogged sink or tub drain.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised and is Super Gross
customer_reviews.text: Picked up these to help with our bathroom sinks that had been draining very slowly even after dumping drano down them. Turns out there was globs of nasty hair / snot looking stuff hung up on the drain lever about a foot down the drain pipe. These grabbers are good quality and can easily make it down to the trap and grab anything stuck down there or along the way. Didn't use the orange pipe cleaner things, but they look like they would work as well, but the claw was more fun looking. Cleaned it off afterwards with soap and water and let dry for next time.
customer_reviews.author: Gear Know-How

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly effective for very little money
customer_reviews.text: Cleared my bathroom sink in less than three minutes and for CHEAP! Gotta love that. Used the plastic spiked thing first. Got lots of stuff out. Then some 'stuff' was hanging up in the drain and that's where the 'grabby' thing came in handy. You need both. Well worth the money to clear bathroom sink drains. Might work on tubs, too, but I haven't needed it for that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Frog4aday

customer_reviews.title: This might be my favorite recent purchase, works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This arrived at 2PM and I immediately used it on a drain that a popular drain cleaner (2 bottles of maximum strength) was not able to open. Within 2 passes I had a huge amount of hair that was removed and the drain was working like it was just put in. Trying this product was my last chance of clearing it myself before calling a plumber! I'm very pleased with the results and the amount of money I saved! Thank you for your easy to use product. Now I need to go and write a bad review on an expensive drain cleaner that did nothing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so impressed and it worked just as I thought with the claw tool. I have dealt with a clogged shower for over a year and all the hair and gunk that came out just made my jaw dropped. Whoever gets grossed out easily better look away when removing whatever hairball monster in the drain. If you do use the claw tool: when you go in just have the claw open to catch everything in its way and clamp down when you can tell it has something. Make sure to also remove that cap above the drain and do the same several times maybe. I found doing that worked better.
customer_reviews.author: Leny Kong

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as you would expect.
customer_reviews.text: The zip tie thing worked great. We moved into a house that was only six years old, but the shower didn't drain well. I used this, and it pulled out a hairball the size of a rat. Shower drains great now. You can probably use them more than once, but the little teeth do break, so effectiveness is definitely going to decrease over time. Saving the metal gripper thing to use as a car detailing tool to get leaves out of tight spaces. Haven't tried it yet but it seems like it will work really well for that.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Use this over drano!
customer_reviews.text: Drano is known to damage your pipes and could be potentially toxic. These these cleaning tools, I was able to remove all the hair and gunk from my shower drain. I'm extremely satisfied with my purchase and will be purchasing more if I run into these problems again. Each pack comes in 5 and 2 metal ones. I prefer the plastic ones because they don't damage the pipes. The only problem I had was the fact that the "claws" sometimes clipped off when I was removing the tool from the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Byron

customer_reviews.title: Senhai 7 Pack Drain Snake Works Well and Inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: 7 Pack Drain Snake is a quick way to clear a clog in the bathroom and kitchen sink and mudroom utility-tub. I was able to clear the bathroom sink and utility-tub is 5 minutes using the plastic drain snake. The spikes along both sides of the strip helped pull the hair out. The steel snake will be helpful for clearing short-distance clog in the bathtub and even the toilet. It's a convenient and inexpensive way to clear a short-distance clog less than 18". I highly recommend this set.
customer_reviews.author: Chopintho N. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The orange snakes are too short and or too flimsy to clear any typical sink drain. Those will simply not push through r into any type of blockage. The spring metal snakes are also too short and the design of the tip which covers the "claw" does not allow the snake to navigate any type of curve or bend on a typical sink drain. This product is inexpensive so I took a chance. I could have just stuffed the $8.00 I spent on these down one of my drains and gotten the same effect as I did by purchasing them.
customer_reviews.author: F

customer_reviews.title: slimy, yet satisfying
customer_reviews.text: I attacked the clog in my bathtub with the orange zippy kind. When I fed it down the drain, I found I could only go about 12" before it hit what feels like a wall. But it was long enough. I pulled it back out along with a hamster-sized slimy ball of hair. I gagged, but what does one expect? My drain is flowing again. I don't know why I need 5 of them ... I rinsed this one off, and it is clearly reusable. I haven't had occasion to test out the metal auger-looking one with the go-go-gadget grabby claw on the end.
customer_reviews.author: Joot

customer_reviews.title: Orange things work well.
customer_reviews.text: The metal things did not work well on our bathtub drain but the orange plastic things were great. We used it on the drain of the tub my daughter (who has very long hair) uses and they pulled out a lot of hair a a few of those covers that come on disposable razors. Need to have a talk with her about that. The stuff that came out was foul smelling and difficult to remove so we just threw the orange plastic things away. I ordered some more of those.
customer_reviews.author: MNP

customer_reviews.title: So easy
customer_reviews.text: Since the lock down, I have been left in charge of cleaning our showers, which unfortunately includes the drains. Nothing coming back up from those things are any good. Drippy, smelly, thick sludge. Well, these items help make that task a lot quicker and slicker. The grabber one especially came in handy for the shower drain that I could have made a pet out of whatever I pulled out from there. Overall, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Katastrophe

customer_reviews.title: Really works.
customer_reviews.text: My shower drain had got so slow there would be 2 + inches of water in the tub even if I took a short shower. Then it would take forever to drain. These arrived today. Used one of the plastic ones on the drain. Could not believe the gunky hair it got up. After I got all the hair out I could with it I put some baking soda and vinegar down it just to get rid of any left over soap scum. It works fantastic now. Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Did not work in our tub. We have a rather tight drain plug and it was difficult to get down into the drain. The plastic orange ones seem to work better than the metal ones which are suppose to grab the hair with a retractable grabber. The orange ones have small spikes (like rose thorns) all along the base which are suppose to hook onto the hair as you pull them out of the drain.
customer_reviews.author: valerie k

customer_reviews.title: Worked!
customer_reviews.text: I had a small clog in my bathroom sink, just hair, but it removed it all within minutes! The clog was towards the top of the drain, but I did take the snake through a couple of passes. It worked great, no pieces broke off or anything like that. I haven't had the opportunity to use the metal snake so can't comment on that. It has a thicker head so it can't get into the smaller drains.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing for how cheap it was. Our drain had been clogged for awhile and we were trying drano along with other products like that with no luck. We got these and my husband unclogged it within seconds. He didn't have to remove the drain or anything it fit right in the opening. I will say it is a little gross what you pull out especially if you have people with long hair in your house, but the product worked amazing. It was very easy to clean which is great because you can reuse them. I was a little nervous because I thought they would be pretty cheap just looking at the pics but they worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Carlie

customer_reviews.title: The plastic tool works better than the metal tool(see attached photo)
customer_reviews.text: I found the plastic tool very useful in pulling hair out of the sink and shower drain. I was able to clean it off quickly and reuse it. The metal tool is not helpful as expected because it gets stuck in the drain grill and wont go far enough to pull and other junk from the drain. The orange plastic toll was a come along item when I purchased the metal tool
customer_reviews.author: Liju

customer_reviews.title: The Orange Things Work...
customer_reviews.text: So the orange things here work great. Pulled out all the nasty hair and such out of my bathroom sink no problem. I tired to use the gripper things on my kitchen sink but because my kitchen sink is two sides that meet in the middle, there was no way to get down that middle tube. So, for what you pay their fine but don't expect to replace an actual plumber if that it is what you really need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good drain cleaning tools
customer_reviews.text: I had a couple drains in our master bath that started draining a little slow and guessed it was probably hair and soap clogs. Was able to use these tools and at least one drain is now flowing freely. Wish they were a little longer though. But is was easy to order and they shipped quickly and were well packaged. For the price they are a good value.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Dixon

customer_reviews.title: To my great surprise, the snake took my plugged drain from ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased upon the recommendation of a friend. Otherwise, I would have placed these in the gimmick category. To my great surprise, the snake took my plugged drain from nearly completely clogged to free flowing just like that. Kind of an unpleasant looking gob of guck came out, so be sure to have your gloves and a cleaning bucket near-by. But two+ weeks after this cleaning, the drain is free flowing like new.
customer_reviews.author: Nugget Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Hard to manipulate. Stiff. Hard to use the clamp. The only pro is that you can get to the trap and twist this in and spin it until it may or may not un jam the blockage but don’t expect to bring anything out with this...so you take the chance of sending the blockage further down the pipe. I wouldn’t recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: KLo

customer_reviews.title: must have item for everyone who lives in a house
customer_reviews.text: I use these tools at least once a month to clear up drains for the shower and sink. I live at home with 3 sisters and they shed so much hair that its almost impossible for them to not clog a sink or drain by accident. using these tools, I have unclogged a majority of drains at home, and makes drains perform like they should.
customer_reviews.author: Dexterity

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: This product broke off in my bathroom sink and I had to get a plumber to remove it! Company should pay for that visit!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: These break
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these drain cleaners for years from a different company, but liked that this package had 5 instead of 3. In the past, I could reuse these with no issues, but when I tried to insert the cleaner into the drain, it broke. I think these are a bit more brittle and cheaply made than my previous purchases. I'll definitely buy again, but probably from my original vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Mrsdillpickle

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: This works like a charm! Better than anything I've ever used. It took me probably 2 minutes to get a ton of Gunk and hair pulled out of my drain and get it draining perfectly again. This is all I will ever need from now on. It so easy and quick to use and get the drains cleared! I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Plastic ones are not good.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic ones are a waste. Even though that's what I wanted primarily. They're too thin and flimsy to be useful. Had to go to the Dollar Store to get the right ones. But the two metal 'grabbers' are good for the price, so I didn't bother returning.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cline

customer_reviews.title: Ewwww....it worked. :0)
customer_reviews.text: Was very impressed. I read a few reviews prior to buying and decided to put in my cart. I can't believe the yucky stuff that will come up when you pull up everything up. My recommendation is once you insert the orange rod thing don't pull up quickly. Once it grabs what is clogging the sink, you'll feel it but could possibly get stuck if not pulled up gently. I almost tugged on it and knew it would break or get stuck if pulled up too quickly. Once it has something it will not let the stuff go. My sink is now cleared and working as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Barba

customer_reviews.title: These are extremely cheap, shorter than the name brand ...
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely cheap, shorter than the name brand, and are extremely flimsy. Won’t be purchasing again. I tossed them after one attempt.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Saved me!
customer_reviews.text: You got to try it! It will save you whatever is clogging your drain. It unclogged my drain at the first use. I thought, well if it breaks or whatever I'll just go down there anyway and see what's the issue. But they are not easy to brake. People that are braking them are not being careful I guess. No, they are not easy to clean, to be honest, but why keep them after doing the job? I threw mine away, they are not expensive and they will smell bad after using them. Very recommendable!
customer_reviews.author: Sttefan

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you need it to fit through your shower grate.
customer_reviews.text: It was bigger than it said it was and won't fit through my cemented grate, and then you can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It really works.
customer_reviews.text: My bathroom sink was totally clogged with hair, and this cleared it completely. I had to insert the plastic implement a few times, but it was easy quick, and also easy to clean for reuse. I am not sure what size drain the metal implement is meant for. It was too big to fit in my bathroom sink or shower drains.
customer_reviews.author: cbc

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: These are perfectly adequate and the price is amazing. I love the little grabby sticks with the pincers that pop out. The plastic sticks are okay and do the job but I don't see them holding up to a lot of reuse. However, the price is amazing and makes it 100% worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ntreeg

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The plastic drain leaders here were so flimsy I couldn't push them thru an elbow without them folding up, I realize they need to be flexible, but these are lame. The other metal piece works just fine, so went 3 stars to balance that out
customer_reviews.author: M.W. Beau

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This product is definitely easy to use. The metals ones are easy to clean. I did not clean the orange plastic one however, after what came out of my sink you would have thrown it away as well. The sink no longer has a clog and I have put the extras in my tool box.
customer_reviews.author: Dygit Alyse

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I knew my bathtub drain was full of hair just didn't realize it was this much! 🤢 These tools worked great. I pulled stuff with the orange thing and the metal grabber. Would buy it again. It was also nice that I didn't have to use chemicals to unclog my drain .
customer_reviews.author: C. N.

customer_reviews.title: Gunk buster!
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money. Will designed tool this is easy to use. Cleared all the hair and gunk from the bath sink in a short few minutes. Made my bath sink great again. Won't be using chemicals to clean any more.
customer_reviews.author: vishal rana

customer_reviews.title: Pulled a bunch of stuff from the sewer
customer_reviews.text: Have been plunging the pipes for a while with not very good results. Tried the pipe cleaning liquid once with just temporary result. Used the plastic stuff in this package and was able to pull out a bunch of fiber that cleaned up the pipes.
customer_reviews.author: Harish Goli

customer_reviews.title: Works but may break when pulling hair out of the drain.
customer_reviews.text: These really helped unclog the bath tub drain. Much better than draino. I feel good keeping the environment free of the heavy chemicals that I would have used with draino. However, I gave it four stars since a piece of the Zipline broke off when I tried to pull it out of the drain. Now there is about a 2 inch piece of plastic somewhere down my drain. I'm hoping it flushes down. Not as environmentally friendly as I wanted it to be but hopefully better than using toxic chemicals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: does not work do not buy
customer_reviews.text: The orange pieces pulled up almost nothing at all, and the metal pieces did not bend well enough to access very far down the pipes. The metal head ended up being too big to get past a number of drains with a cross piece in the middle of the drain. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Got these to spring clean my bathroom drains and they did the job. The plastic ones actually last for more passes than I thought down the drains. They come with more than one plastic one because obviously when used multiple times/passes, the plastic side spikes become dull and no longer sharp for grabbing drain grossness.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Very poor product. Better off buying a real snake or calling a plumber. I could not retrieve a single thing from the pipes with either of these two tools. Only thing I can imagine the metal clasp grabbing is a lost ring in the drain. They just do not reach far enough down to grab anything that is actually causing a clog in the drain.
customer_reviews.author: SherBear

customer_reviews.title: Cleared up my drain!
customer_reviews.text: My shower was draining slower than usual, I figured it had some hair stuck since I have long hair and I shed hair by the pound. I used these plastic snakes and pulled out a few (disgustingly) giant knots of hair. I also purchased some Drano to use after but I didn't think it was necessary anymore. This took care of it, back to normal!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical...
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit I was skeptical about this product. I had a sink that was draining slowly. Due to the sink I could not remove the plunger. The Senhai sewer dredging tool absolutely did the trick. I personally would not clean and re-use them but that is me. Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What!!!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this product because my drain is always slow. I stuck this down the drain and wanted to scream. All of that gunk came out. It was gross to say the least. Glad I brought it and it's reusable too. Drains like new.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Plastic removers break inside drains
customer_reviews.text: The steel grippers look sturdy, but won't fit inside a bathroom drain. The plastic hair removers are took stiff and the 2 I used broke inside the drain. Luckily I was able to remove with pliers but it wasn't easy. I would not recommend these at all if your goal is to remove bathroom hair clogs.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah B

customer_reviews.title: Warning: CHEAP Plastic
customer_reviews.text: I have used these drain 'hair pullers' 'fishers', but the orange plastic materials appear to be too cheap to withstand my tub drain's L-shaped pipe. Half the fisher snapped off in the drain :>O. I would not buy this again. It could possibly make my drain worse! Better off going to local hardware store for a heavier, pliable plastic version.
customer_reviews.author: HLGandKLG

customer_reviews.title: I am embarrased for purchasing these!
customer_reviews.text: I thought to myself: "hey, they're cheap so I don't care if they don't work." Now I feel silly for purchaing such junk. The flimsy plastic pieces don't work. They would need to have some firmness to go down the drain but they just get twisted up like string. I feel silly. The spring-loaded things actaully appear to be of decent quality but I don't need them to get hairs from the blocked drain.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Quincy

customer_reviews.title: Sooo useful.
customer_reviews.text: I have long thick hair that frequently clogs the drains. This is an amazing little tool that makes getting it out super easy. I love that I got two with the claw on the end and then several of the “disposable” ones. Easy to fit into the drain and does a great job at removing clogs.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Sullivan Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Really works!
customer_reviews.text: Our drains tend to clog often since my daughter has loooong hair. We'd been using chemicals to clear the drains, but I finally ordered these little cleaning tools. They really work! It just takes a few jobs into the drain. Very pleased with the product, and love that it helps keep the water supply cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: savingsinseconds

customer_reviews.title: No more clogs
customer_reviews.text: The metal ones worked ok with my bathroom sink hair clog, but then I tried the orange ones and it took two tries and the clog was GONE! It was amazing. I would post a picture but it was gross.
customer_reviews.author: Dezeri Royce

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Both items (plastic and steel) fit through the holes in my shower drain. It was pretty clogged with hair. Surprisingly the metal item did what I needed. Took a few times to get it all but worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Kraig J. Marton

customer_reviews.title: Worked well to unclog the hairball in my drain.
customer_reviews.text: The drain is draining better now than it has for a long time. Very impressed with the way the plastic piece grabbed the hairball and the way the metal grabber grabbed the hairball to help get it out of the drain. Will buy again from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Bills

customer_reviews.title: Quick arrival; excellent product; works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly as described. Frankly the metal grippers are significantly of better quality than at the local dollar store. they all come curled up in a mailer, but they easily are straightened. The plastic ones are the right combination of stiff and flexible, to do the sink trap unclogging. This is a very good and cheap product. They also came very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: NinoUpte7

customer_reviews.title: Buy it worth your money
customer_reviews.text: THIS THING IS SUPER CHEAPS AND AMAZING. Work like a charm. My bath tub has been struggle to drain waters for months and finally someone recommended me to buy this product. Buy it use it and one minute and fifteen seconds later, MAGIC HAPPENS. The water drain extremely fast after done using it. This product is the best and it totally can reusable if uou dont mind cleaning up the dirty hair. LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for drain snakes
customer_reviews.text: Is what it is. The plastic snakes are great and do what they should. The metal snakes are good, the tips don’t align perfect and we’re a slight different in lengths but overall are an excellent buy and I’d recommend them to anyone. Can’t beat the buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: worked better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I used the plastic one to clean the shower drain. Inserted it and tried to move it in a circular motion. I could not believe how much stuff it puled out of the drain! It took me about 2 minutes and the drain was clean!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than drain clearing chemicals!
customer_reviews.text: The sink in my daughter's bathroom is perpetually clogged. In our rental agreement it states we're not permitted to use drain cleaner so that left me looking for another solution. The plastic drain clog remove worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: BethBakes

customer_reviews.title: Gets stuck in drain
customer_reviews.text: I used the plastic one in my sink drain and it kept getting stuck even though there was nothing on the end of the snake when I finally was able to pull it out. I was afraid I would not be able to get it out and would have to pull my whole drain apart or it would break in the drain. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works!! You don't even want to know what ...
customer_reviews.text: Works!! You don't even want to know what I fished out of my sinks. Luckily, I don't have a picture to share. Lets just say it does exactly what it says it does.
customer_reviews.author: M_fromTX

customer_reviews.title: Best no-chemical solution!
customer_reviews.text: This did the trick when my bathtub drain was partially plugged with hair. I used the orange one. It quickly pulled out all the hair in just a couple of insertions. Best part: it's so inexpensive I could just throw that nasty mess away! No more fumes from chemical drain opener, either. My lungs appreciate that!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Not bad... Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. I would not recommend keeping them around for multiple uses. The pinchers work ok. Good tools for grabbing little bolts that drop somewhere... not really something I would use in a drain. One came busted, but for the price I couldn't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan R.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly impressed. When I got these they looked cheap and flimsy. We paid $10 for a nice thick one from Lowes, and thesae worked SO much better, didn’t break like the one we bought from LOWES, and you get 5 plus two NICR metal grabbers!!! Amazing deal.
customer_reviews.author: katieAnnH

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: The product looks identical to the picture. Overall, it does its job in removing hair from clogged drains. However, it is not suitable for all household drains. For my bathtub and sink drains, the snake gets stuck and doesn’t get anything out.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Cai

customer_reviews.title: What a difference..
customer_reviews.text: Man what a difference..worked like a charm and almost upset my stomach when I saw all the hair come out..yuk! Thank you for this easy fix that works a lot better than Draino..
customer_reviews.author: Billiam

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These worked great. We bought tub, sink, and shower shrooms. Before installing I wanted to make sure it was all cleaned out. These did the job and like that I have the two metal ones to keep using.
customer_reviews.author: BigRedGolfer

customer_reviews.title: More efficient than any chemical product
customer_reviews.text: I have had clogging issues in my bathtub for a long time and I was tired of spending money and pouring super corrosive things in the environment so I bought this. This is far better and more efficient than any chemical product I used before. It is eco-friendly, cheaper, faster and lasts longer. This is definitely a MUST-Have in your house!
customer_reviews.author: costumer21

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: I used the plastic one for my bathroom sink drain to remove a hair clog. It took several times to remove all the goop, but it worked. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: John F. Bolden Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disposable
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and as described. The stainless steel one broke within 20 seconds of use. The wire snapped as I gently pulled in a clump of hair.
customer_reviews.author: Michael-Ann

customer_reviews.title: Nice Snake
customer_reviews.text: Drain Snakes were very easy to use and produced a lot of hair from the drains. It cleared out my shower, tub and bathroom sink drains. Was very pleased with the results and will be buying them again.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Great product, at a very low cost.
customer_reviews.text: My bathroom sinks get clogged by long hair. Access to clean them out is is a slow process. Those little plastic, toothed tools may not look impressie, however they do a great job in cleaning out the sink drains by going through the drain hole in the sink and it only took 2 minutes of time. I have a septic tank and really hate draino and liquid plumber. These tools are cheaper, work better, and are much kinder to my septic tank . On a scale pf 1-5 stars I give them a 6.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme O.

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders!
customer_reviews.text: These drain snakes really help saved my drains. I had standing water in my shower from my hair that went down the drain after each wash. I was able to pull out wads of hair after I used the drain snake and now I have no standing water. :)
customer_reviews.author: Tapangax

customer_reviews.title: Nice pack of essentials for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it needs to do. Plastic a little th hick but works if you work it q bit. Excellent price for what is included.
customer_reviews.author: ajarn

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: The orange plastic drain cleaners are so old and brittle they break in the pipe. The metal tools are ok but don't fit into most metal grated drain pipes.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Rosas-Guyon

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Great item for the intended use. It is not as easy to clean but I would use the stick more than once if there is not too much gunk on it.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: These things are amazing! The metal ones don’t work but the orange ...
customer_reviews.text: These things are amazing! The metal ones don’t work but the orange plastic ones pulled up globs of hair and my drains are working like new again. I highly recommend these if your drains are clogged or not draining well.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Good use for quarterly maintenance.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, they are effective considering the alternative price of calling a plumber. Pulled a ton of discussing hair, mildew and debris from the drain. Drained smooth for a couple months then had to use again. This time however much less hair and debris. Will continue using for quarterly maintenance. Like many of the reviews state the teeth do break off quite easily, but I still believed this item is very much worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a clog that has been persistent for months.
customer_reviews.text: This simple product worked great on our sink that has been backing up for months. It was affordable, easy to use and worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Tara RL

customer_reviews.title: No chemicals needed!
customer_reviews.text: Got a new sink and it clogs quite easily than my old sink (from 1970's at least). The plastic ones helped and cleared it all up! Love not having to use chemicals! Just removed the gunk, cleaned the tool and let it dry for next time! Haven't used the other items.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: handy easy to use snake
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Immediately solved a clogged drain. Much easier and convenient operation than using a metal drain snake - after use, just toss out the plastic snake and the clog mess. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: S L Richardson

customer_reviews.title: gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: i have used these for years go to tools also grabber is great for auto also used them when i was in maintenance
customer_reviews.author: PATRICK TRACY ist sharkbait

customer_reviews.title: seems nice
customer_reviews.text: have not used it yet - but wanted a set in the house should n]the need arise... looks like it will work fine
customer_reviews.author: als.josh

customer_reviews.title: Quick and efficient
customer_reviews.text: This did the job very well. Pulled out my daughters and wife hair from the drain with ease. Wish more can inside for the price. Had no use for the metal extension so I got creative and used it on my wife as a nipple clamp
customer_reviews.author: Rocky gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: great device at a great price
customer_reviews.text: One snake costs this same amount at Lowe's. Great value....especially since it can save a $75+ call to the plumber
customer_reviews.author: J.J.

customer_reviews.title: Not working for me
customer_reviews.text: I have not been able to get these to work for me in my bathroom sink. Not sure what “sheerness” is about.
customer_reviews.author: Angelena

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It's so darned simple and works so well to pull the hair and gunk up out of any drain. I broke the pack up and gave my sister and parents one and they love it, too. You can't beat this package for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mythic Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, easy drain cleaner.
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding product. Its easy to use, inexpensive, eliminates strong chemicals. If you own a sink you need some of these.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rehfeldt

customer_reviews.title: Worth ever penny paid.
customer_reviews.text: Long reach grabbers are really well made and hair tangerlers do a bang up good job and simple to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Blacky

customer_reviews.title: Killer little machines
customer_reviews.text: These things are beasts at clearing drains. I love them, cleaned every drain in my house and had fun doing it. The plastic orange ones are the ones I like the most.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Did the Job!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at unplugging my drain. I used it for bathroom and bathtub, which of course had lots of hair and gross accumulation. I used the "disposable" looking orange one and it stayed in shape and is in great enough wear that I could use it a couple more times. Great price and great product.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Gross but works
customer_reviews.text: This thing works wonders be prepared to see a bunch of grossness come out of your drains ... yuck. Not really easy to clean but gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: Sharlitha Reed

customer_reviews.title: Works, but not as well as I was hoping.
customer_reviews.text: As someone who loses a lot of hair int he shower, I was hoping this would clean the drain well. It did - somewhat, but left about half behind. I wish the 'teeth' would be bigger to grab more.
customer_reviews.author: MomOfBoyz

customer_reviews.title: Worked amazingly great
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even need to use the orange snakes. The metal tongs were enough to help me chip at and eventually pull out nearly a pound of hair and gross sludge out of my shower drain. Glad that it came with so many pieces to help me if it happens again. This was definitely a great value buy and saved me a plumber visit.
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Broke a few of the plastic ones on the first use and the metal ones didn't fit down the drain but it got the job done and they are cheap
customer_reviews.author: Rdvark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent amateur plumbing snakes
customer_reviews.text: These are terrific tools for getting all the hair and other gunk out of your faucet. And although I think the plastic ones are designed to be disposable, there's no reason you can't clean them off (if you're not disgusted by what you find coming out of your faucet) and reuse at least several more times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: SENHAI 7 Pack Sewer Dredging Tools, 20 inch Hair Drain Clog Remover Drain Relief Auger Cleaning Tool (2 Stainless Steel and 5 Plastic)
feature_bullets: PACKAGE INCLUDING: 7 Pack Drain Dredging Tools Hair Drain Clog Remover Drain Auger Cleaning Tool (2 stainless steel and 5 plastic drain cleaners).

WIDE APPLICATION: Widely used for cleaning bathrooms, kitchen, sinks, tubs, and dredging pipe, drain, sewers and other places clogged often. Multi-tooth drain cleaners efficiently catch hair, food and other blockages.
MORE CONVENIENT: Offers two cleaning tools, a tool that can capture a solid obstruction, another tool hook the hair and debris.
EXCELLENT LENGTH: 20'' long enough to insert to deep pipes, hold the loop, easily pull out blockages.
MORE ENVIRONMENTAL and LESS EXPENSIVE than toxic chemical drain cleaners.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,126 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
